pull.title: lint: Misc improvements for lint runner
pull.body:
1. Document the dependency to rust being installed locally
2. Add the build output directory to gitignore
3. Clean up the build output directory when running `make clean`

events.message: lint: Add lint runner build dir and lint pycache to clean task

events.body: Rebased to give the CI a chance to show green and took the suggested rewording from @maflcko .

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -338,7 +338,7 @@ clean-docs:
 clean-local: clean-docs
 	rm -rf coverage_percent.txt test_bitcoin.coverage/ total.coverage/ fuzz.coverage/ test/tmp/ cache/ $(OSX_APP)
 	rm -rf test/functional/__pycache__ test/functional/test_framework/__pycache__ test/cache share/rpcauth/__pycache__
-	rm -rf osx_volname dist/
+	rm -rf osx_volname dist/ test/lint/test_runner/target/
comments.body: We also don't delete the `test/lint/__pycache__`, maybe a good opportunity to add it?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -338,7 +338,7 @@ clean-docs:
 clean-local: clean-docs
 	rm -rf coverage_percent.txt test_bitcoin.coverage/ total.coverage/ fuzz.coverage/ test/tmp/ cache/ $(OSX_APP)
 	rm -rf test/functional/__pycache__ test/functional/test_framework/__pycache__ test/cache share/rpcauth/__pycache__
-	rm -rf osx_volname dist/
+	rm -rf osx_volname dist/ test/lint/test_runner/target/

@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body: Not sure about prescribing a specific installation method. Anyone should be free to use whatever method they like the most.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body:
That was also my intention with this link. It recommends one installation method but makes clear this is just a recommendation and also links to [other installation methods available](https://forge.rust-lang.org/infra/other-installation-methods.html). What alternative solution would you suggest?

Also, I think generally in the docs we often just suggest one specific installation method for dependencies, like `brew` for macos or `apt-get` for Ubuntu etc. although there are other options available.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body:
> What alternative solution would you suggest?

Not adding a link? Seems unlikely that someone doesn't know how to install packages, and at the same time can not use a search engine? https://duckduckgo.com/?t=ffab&q=install+the+rust+toolchain

> apt-get for Ubuntu

Yeah, using the distro-shipped package manager seems to be normally the first choice and the most likely method to work in most machine-settings?

(No strong opinion in any case)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body:
>Not adding a link? Seems unlikely that someone doesn't know how to install packages, and at the same time can not use a search engine?

Anyone using a search engine will either end up on this page (first result) or another page that suggests the same install method, so we may save people that indirection and [keep them safer in the process too](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malvertising). 

How about just copying from the experts? https://github.com/rust-bitcoin/rust-bitcoin?tab=readme-ov-file#installing-rust, i.e. this: "Rust can be installed using your package manager of choice or [rustup.rs](https://rustup.rs/). The former way is considered more secure since it typically doesn't involve trust in the CA system. But you should be aware that the version of Rust shipped by your distribution might be out of date."

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body:
> version of Rust shipped by your distribution might be out of date.

Not sure. I disagree that a version of a rust compiler shipped with a commonly used distro can be "out of date". This opinion is based on the broken assumption that developers only ever use the latest toolchain.

It would be better to support as many compiler versions as possible, if reasonable.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
comments.body: Ok, then I am keeping this as is for now but I will remove the link if more reviewers share your opinion that it should be removed.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,13 +16,15 @@ result is cached and it prevents issues when the image changes.
 test runner
 ===========
 
-To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker, use:
+To run all the lint checks in the test runner outside the docker you first need
+to [install the rust toolchain](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) locally.
+Then you can use:
 
 ```sh
 ( cd ./test/lint/test_runner/ && cargo fmt && cargo clippy && RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo run )
 ```
 
-#### Dependencies
+#### Python dependencies
comments.body: Not sure if this is correct. For example, ShellCheck is written in Haskell, not Python.

nit (feel free to ignore)

```suggestion
to install the rust toolchain using your package manager of choice or [rustup](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install).
```
